alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 4:39PM MST until September 10 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 745 PM MST /845 PM MDT/. * At 437 PM MST /537 PM MDT/, National Weather Service Flagstaff Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over US 160 west of Kayenta. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Church Rock Valley. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 398 and 412. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Laguna Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
